p: B16F1 melanoma cells under standardized cell culture conditions [ 15, 25] and 5-Brd-2′-dU [ 14, 21, 26, 35] presented changes in melanin concentrations ( Figure 1b) (Pearson’s correlation coefficient 0.999). Fluorometry and colorimetry allowed the detection of increase (9 X) and decrease (5 X) in melanin concentration in B16 cells exposed to L-Tyr and 5-Brd-2′-dU, respectively ( Figure 1f). However, fluorometry was more sensitive (detection limit 0.098 µg.mL −1 and CV of 9.85%); this hyperpigmentation has also been described in primary culture melanocytes exposed to high concentrations of the amino acid L-tyrosine [ 48, 49].
